Articles.Content: I've built a station around the Mun and I can't seem to transfer the fuel from one module to another. I do know how to transfer fuel (Alt + Right click) as i've done it before. It is a possible bug for ksp 1.2?
There's a per-save option for fuel transfer obeying crossfeed rules, if you have that enabled and something is in-between the two tanks that doesn't allow crossfeed that would be the issue.
Also, if you're early enough in career you may not have unlocked the ability. As it's (IIRC) R&D level 2, though, by the time you're building stations you've probably unlocked it.

2 hours ago, regex said:

There's a per-save option for fuel transfer obeying crossfeed rules, if you have that enabled and something is in-between the two tanks that doesn't allow crossfeed that would be the issue.

Thank you!  That's what was doing it to me.  Crud... I'm going to have to completely rethink my docking port layouts.
Is there a way to change this once the game is underway? Or do I have to start over again to change it?
Looks like this has turned into a Gameplay Question. And so, moved.

22 hours ago, RocketBlam said:

Is there a way to change this once the game is underway? Or do I have to start over again to change it?

Pause menu/Settings/Difficutly Options/Advanced/'Resource Transfer Obeys Crossfeed Rules" -- Accept, Apply, Accept.

On 11/1/2016 at 10:19 PM, bewing said:

Pause menu/Settings/Difficutly Options/Advanced/'Resource Transfer Obeys Crossfeed Rules" -- Accept, Apply, Accept.

 

I tried this but it was already disabled
